I’d start by watching them closely, really studying their body language and the way they speak. People who don’t know the truth often have that glazed look in their eyes, like they’re half-asleep in a lab coat or something. They trust too easily. I’ve seen it with my own two eyes—when you tell them the truth, their first reaction is usually denial. But that’s okay. Denial is just the first stage of awakening.

I’d start by asking questions, not giving answers. Questions like, “Have you ever wondered why they push so many vaccines on healthy kids? Or why the same handful of pharmaceutical companies control so much of the world’s medicine?” People don’t like to hear that, but they start thinking. And once they start thinking, the truth begins to crack through the lies.

I’d show them the patterns. Like how every time a new illness pops up, the same companies suddenly have a “solution” ready. That’s not coincidence, that’s not science. That’s control. You don’t need a medical degree to see it if you just look at the big picture. I’d share stories—real stories. People who went to the doctor, got a prescription, and ended up worse. Or worse, dead. And the doctors just shrug and say, “It’s a side effect.”

I’d tell them about the cover-ups. The ones that never make the news, the ones they want you to forget. Like how certain supplements or natural cures were proven to work, but were buried by the system. They don’t want you to get well, because if you do, you’re not a customer anymore. You’re a threat to their bottom line.

And I’d warn them not to trust the media, not to trust the government, not to trust the big hospitals with their white coats and their fancy titles. Those are just masks. Underneath, they’re all part of the same machine. The only way to survive is to be informed, to be skeptical, and to question everything. Because the truth is out there—it’s just that they don’t want you to see it.

But if you keep digging, if you keep asking the right questions, the truth will come to you. And once you see it, there’s no going back. That’s what they’re afraid of. Not the medicine, not the disease. They’re afraid of the truth. And I’m not.
